alert.note: Alert for Dodge (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 11:39PM CDT until April 19 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: .Street flooding occurring in Fremont. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of east central Nebraska, including the following county, Dodge. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM CDT, the public reported street flooding in Fremont. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont, Inglewood, Woodcliff and Fremont Lakes State Recreation Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
